page.title: 14CHILDHOOD MEMORIES 1910-20 1
page.content: Ena Hunt,born 1906,lived in Hunt Cottage,Budbrooke.Attended new school in Hampton on the Hill.Only pump in schoolmasters yard.Each morning a boy filled a bucket with water and put it with a mug in corridor so that children could have a drink in day - rather dirty by 4.Stove in Infant room.Teacher made cocoa in cold weather.Children who lived a distance away stayed dinner.A treat was to be given a penny to buy a tin of bloater paste from the post office to put on bread.The Vicar was 'Dodger'Hunt.Said to be because he dodged choir boys to put off paying them.Every one went to church,families from big houses having own pews.Children sat in front of verger and if shuffled during sermon hit with cane.Church cleaner's girls always had nice hair ribbons-taken off the flowers sent to funerals.
